meanings.definition: To feel disgust or strong dislike.
meanings.sent1: She scunnered at the sight of the slimy snail.
meanings.sent2: I am scunnered by the smell of rotten eggs.
meanings.sent3: The cat scunnered at the taste of the bitter medicine.
meanings.sent4: The idea of eating bugs scunnered her like nothing else.
meanings.sent5: The garbage left in the sun for days scunnered everyone in the neighborhood.

meanings.definition: A feeling of disgust or strong dislike.
meanings.sent1: His scunnered was evident from the look on his face.
meanings.sent2: The scunnered towards the movie was shared by many in the audience.
meanings.sent3: The scunnered in the room was palpable when the spoiled food was discovered.
meanings.sent4: She couldn't hide her scunnered for broccoli, even with cheese sauce.
meanings.sent5: The scunnered in her voice was unmistakable as she talked about the rude customer.

meanings.definition: To cause someone to feel disgust or strong dislike.
meanings.sent1: The foul smell scunnered the guests at the party.
meanings.sent2: The rude behavior of the man scunnered his coworkers.
meanings.sent3: The prank was meant to scunner her, but she ended up laughing.
meanings.sent4: The sight of blood can easily scunner some people.
meanings.sent5: The taste of the medicine scunnered him so much he couldn't swallow it.
